47909-d-03-21-82-RFP.Accident Cause: Other brake defects, cars (Provide detailed description in  narrative)
47909-d-03-21-82-RFP.Narrative: ON MARCH 19, 1982, AT 11:44 PM, THE "RO" LOCAL FREIGHT SET OFF CAR DODX 40081, WHICH WAS LOADED WITHTWO ARMY TRACTOR TANKS (M728), AT THE INTERCHANGE POINT ON THE LOW LINE TRACK WHICH LEADS TO FORT BELVOIR AT NEWINGTON, VA. ON THE MORNING OF MAR 22, 1982, AT APPROXIMATELY 7:00AM, THE LOCOMOTIVE ENGINEER OF THE US ARMY FORT BELVOIR RAILROAD CHECKED THE LOW LINE TRACK AND FOUND CAR DODX 40081 DERAILED AT THE EAST END OF THE LOW LINE TRACK. THE CAR WAS SETTING BOTTOM-SIDE-UP WITH THE TANKS STILL SECURED TO THE CAR AND THE HAND BRAKE WAS IN THE APPLIED POSITION ON THE CAR. THIS CAR WAS LAST SEENSETTING AT THE INTERCHANGE POINT ON THE MORNING OF MAR 21, 1982 AND SOMETIME BETWEEN THAT TIME AND 11:30 PM THAT NIGHT WHEN THE CONDUCTOR OF THE "RO" LOCAL FREIGH NOTICED THE CAR WAS NOT AT THE INTERCHANGE POINT, THE CAR HAD ROLLED 325 FEET EAST DOWN THE LOW LINE TRACK AND STRUCK A DERAIL AT THE FAREAST END OF THE TRACK AND DERAILED. IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE DERAILMENT OCCURRED BECAUSE THE AIRHAD LEAKED FROM THE AIR BRAKE SYSTEM, ALLOWING THE AIR BRAKES TO RELEASE. THE HAND BRAKES WERE APPLIED ON THE CAR BUT THIS CAR HAD HAND BRAKES THAT APPLIED ONLY TO ONE END OF THE CAR.NoneNoneNone
